Detailed Description

Todo:
  • add support for save and restore

LBANN optimizer base class Implements checkpoint and restart

Stochastic gradient descent with Adagrad. lr: float >= 0. Learning rate. epsilon: float >= 0.

Inspired by Kera.io implementation Stochastic gradient descent with RMSprop. lr: float >= 0. Learning rate. rho: float >= 0. epsilon: float >= 0. Fuzz factor.

Inspired by Kera.io implementation Stochastic gradient descent, with support for momentum, decay, and Nesterov momentum. lr: float >= 0. Learning rate. momentum: float >= 0. Parameter updates momentum. decay: float >= 0. Learning rate decay over each update. nesterov: boolean. Whether to apply Nesterov momentum.

void lbann::bernoulli_fill ( ElMat &  mat,
El::Int  m,
El::Int  n,
double  p = 0.5 
)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is an indepenent Bernoulli random variable with parameter p. This makes the same gaurantees as gaussian_fill.

void lbann::bernoulli_fill_procdet ( ElMat &  mat,

El::Int  n,

)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is an independent Bernoulli random variable with parameter p. This makes the same guarantees as gaussian_fill_procdet.

void lbann::gaussian_fill ( ElMat &  mat,
El::Int  m,
El::Int  n,
DataType  mean = 0.0f,
DataType  stddev = 1.0f 
)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is independently drawn from a Gaussian distribution with given mean and standard deviation. Unless selected so at compile-time, this ensures the entries of the matrix do not change as the grid it is distributed over changes; that is, it will have the same entries when mat spans any number of processes.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void lbann::gaussian_fill_procdet ( ElMat &  mat,
El::Int  m,
El::Int  n,
DataType  mean = 0.0f,
DataType  stddev = 1.0f 
)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is independently drawn from a Gaussian distribution with given mean and standard deviation. This always ensures that the entries of the matrix do not change as the grid it is distributed over changes.

rng_gen & lbann::get_generator (  ) 

Return a reference to the global LBANN random number generator.

Note:
If it matters, the generator is not thread-safe.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

00064                 // not an error if the directory already exists

00067                 fprintf(stderr, "ERROR: Failed to create directory `%s' (%d: %s) @ %s:%d\n",

00077 
00078     // return 1 if dir was created successfully
00079     int ret = (mkdir_rc == 0);

the scale for undropped inputs at training time given as

void lbann::uniform_fill ( ElMat &  mat,
El::Int  m,
El::Int  n,
DataType  center = 0.0f,
DataType  radius = 1.0f 
)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is independently uniformly sampled from a ball with the given center and radius. This makes the same guarantees as gaussian_fill.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

DataType  radius = 1.0f 
)

Make mat into an m x n matrix where each entry is independently uniformly sampled from a ball with the given center and radius. This makes the same guarantees as gaussian_fill_procdet.
